definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: At night he would lie sleepless on his cot, suffering an almost unbearable frustration.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他躺在行军床上睡不着觉，灰心丧气难熬难挨。

sentences.english: He was daunted by the amount of work still to be done.
sentences.chinese: 还有那么多工作要做，弄得他灰心丧气。

sentences.english: Resist discouragement and finish the race God has set before you.
sentences.chinese: 克服你的灰心丧气，突破上帝在你面前设下的难关。

sentences.english: Don't let defeat fill you with gloom.
sentences.chinese: 别让失败使你灰心丧气。

sentences.english: Even though I took a tough loss today, I don't feel discouraged in any way.
sentences.chinese: 虽然今天输了球，我并不觉得十分灰心丧气。

sentences.english: Trying to change it only frustrates and exhausts you.
sentences.chinese: 试图改变它只会使你灰心丧气和精疲力竭。

sentences.english: He despaired at the thought of it.
sentences.chinese: 一想到这件事他就感到灰心丧气。

sentences.english: Her words made his heart burn with frustration.
sentences.chinese: 她那些话使他极端灰心丧气。

sentences.english: But to the despondent I whisper that life begins at40.
sentences.chinese: 但对那些灰心丧气的人我却低声说40岁生活才开始。

to abandon oneself to despair/to give up and stop bothering
to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
